intro: Dioscorea albicaulis, commonly known as the white-stemmed yam, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its tubers are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some cultures. The leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered with a fine, white pubescence.
